content.description:
Mildly tricky and with some fun moves thrown in for good measure. Find the key pockets to get to and above the 4th bolt, and then it is cruiser to the anchors. Although a short route its worth doing since youve made the hike.

Listed here at its original rating in the Ruckman guide, but seemed easier than the route to the left.
content.protection:
5 bolts to welded cold-shut anchors

(Two bolts have been added to the route since the Ruckman guide was published.)
content.location: The RIGHT of two routes on the south-west side of the bulge at the left (uphill) end of the buttress.

content.description: Slightly less strenuous but more technical than its neighbor to the right. Probably not worth the hike just to climb these two 5.10s, but worth doing while at Avalanche Buttress. The crux is getting past the second bolt on less than stellar feet and crimps.
content.protection:
4 bolts to welded cold-shut anchors

(The second bolt was added since the Ruckman guide was published.)
content.location: The LEFT of two routes on the south-west side of the bulge at the left (uphill) end of the buttress.
